description: on- +‎ slaught. Formed after Middle Dutch aenslag, aenslach, equivalent to aen +‎ slag, although slaught corresponds to Middle Dutch slacht; slag is cognate with the English weaving term sley. Compare Dutch aanslag and German Anschlag.

entries.meaning: (by extension) A large number of people or things resembling an attack.
examples: They opened the doors and prepared for the onslaught of holiday shoppers.
